Synopsis:
Bobby Walker (Ben Affleck) is living the American dream has a great job, a beautiful family, a stunning Porsche in the garage. When the policy of downsizing leaves him and his colleagues Phil Woodward (Chris Cooper) and Gene McClary (Tommy Lee Jones) out of work, the three men are forced to redefine their lives as men, as husbands and as fathers family.

Bobby finds himself in the position of having to put up coaching sessions, a job as a home builder in the company of his brother (Kevin Costner) which does not use his executive skills and perhaps the realization that life is more to pursue the next and the best deal.
